segments.text: I see the water flowing from that faucet like a never-ending stream, pooling on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s surreal how the woman is unaware of the chaos brewing at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is entirely on polishing that plate, the rest of the world fading away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then, I catch sight of the boy on the stool, a picture of mischief and determination.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What a sight he is, reaching for those cookies with a look of glee on his face.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet I feel my stomach drop as I realize how unstable that stool is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl stands below him, her arm outstretched, completely unaware of the danger only I seem to see.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their innocence in this moment is both charming and terrifying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can’t the woman hear the sloshing water? It’s almost maddening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a perfect picture of domestic life, but with an impending sense of disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
